content: It’s interesting to me that the investor only saw the potential negatives of making a stand, not the potential benefits. Sure, Heller might alienate some potential buyers of her product, but my guess is that, on the balance, her strong support for women’s rights would make her likely buyers more interested in her product. It may help her differentiate herself in a crowded marketplace. As an investor, that is always a positive, even if I didn’t agree with the message. Highlighting what your company stands for may push some people away, but they weren’t going to be great customers anyway if something as simple as a photo is going to make them change their mind.
